head.title: A Theater All Too Near You

hedline.hl1: A Theater All Too Near You

abstract.p: Barbara Bonn letter says DVD players should be banned on airplanes (July 13 article)

block.p: I must take issue with one sentence in ''Have Laptop, Will Travel, With Extreme Care'' (July 13). Should the airline passenger next to me in a cramped coach seat ''fire up 'The Matrix,' '' as Peter H. Lewis suggested, the last thing I would do is ''stare in awe.'' The first thing I would do is get my seat changed.
If that were impossible, my next move would be to read my newspaper -- with the page opened to its full width, rustling it ostentatiously and letting it block my view.

I must take issue with one sentence in ''Have Laptop, Will Travel, With Extreme Care'' (July 13). Should the airline passenger next to me in a cramped coach seat ''fire up 'The Matrix,' '' as Peter H. Lewis suggested, the last thing I would do is ''stare in awe.'' The first thing I would do is get my seat changed.
If that were impossible, my next move would be to read my newspaper -- with the page opened to its full width, rustling it ostentatiously and letting it block my view.

Not that I have anything against DVD, but an action movie imposed on my peripheral vision, compounded by the unavoidable hiss and rumble of somebody else's headphones, simply adds to the misery of flying coach. Ban the bloomin' things, I say.
